Lingshan county in Qinzhou 欽州|钦州[Qin1 zhou1], Guangxi

sentences.english: The nature's great power creates lingshan's spirit stones.
sentences.chinese: 大自然的鬼斧神工造化了灵山奇石。

sentences.english: Lingshan Mountain is the kingdom of stones and the world of stones.
sentences.chinese: 灵山是石的王国，石的世界。

sentences.english: At the same time, lingshan contest the upcoming annual fox spirit.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，灵山一年一度的狐狸精大赛即将举行。

sentences.english: The Soul Mountain Temple begin built in Tan Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 灵山寺位于河南省罗山县，始建于唐朝。

sentences.english: He will talk about his Montagne de Lame series.
Olympus is but the outside of the earth everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 灵山只在大地的外部，处处都是。

sentences.english: You have your own treasure house. Why do you search outside?
sentences.chinese: 你自己就有座灵山宝塔。何必外求？

sentences.english: Between both terrains is Lingshan structural belt Lingshan structural belt.
sentences.chinese: 两地体之间的构造分界线是灵山构造带。

definition: mountain of Immortals
Mount Huaguo in Jiangsu, featured in 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4], tourist destination/(also the name of mountains in other parts of China)
island of the immortals
Temple in Heaven (e.g. of the Jade Emperor)
middle of the forehead/imperial court/heaven
Mt Meru or Sumeru, sacred mountain in Buddhist and Jain tradition/Mt Xumi in Guyuan 固原[Gu4 yuan2], Ningxia, with many Buddhist cave statues
the Western Paradise (Buddhism)
Laozi or Lao-tze (c. 500 BC), Chinese philosopher, the founder of Taoism/the sacred book of Daoism, 道德經|道德经 by Laozi
Kunlun Mountain range
Longevity Hill in the Summer Palace 頤和園|颐和园[Yi2 he2 yuan2], Beijing
the East/China
Taoist or Buddhist rite/abbr. for 菩提道場|菩提道场[Pu2 ti2 dao4 chang3]
the Jade lake on Mount Kunlun, residence of Xi Wangmu 西王母
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
Jade Emperor (in Taoism)
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
